org.apache.freemarker.core.util

Class CallableUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.freemarker.core.util.CallableUtils

  • public final class CallableUtils
extends Object
    Utilities for implementing and calling TemplateCallableModel-s (such as TemplateDirectiveModel-s and TemplateFunctionModel-s).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static TemplateModel[] EMPTY_TEMPLATE_MODEL_ARRAY
      Empty TemplateModel array, useful to avoid array creation for a 0 length argument list.

    • Method Summary

      Don't use it; used internally by FreeMarker, may changes anytime without notice.

      Don't use it; used internally by FreeMarker, may changes anytime without notice.
      static <T extends TemplateModel>
      T      		 castArgumentValue(TemplateModel argValue, int argIdx, Class<T> type, boolean optional, T defaultValue, TemplateCallableModel callable, boolean calledAsFunction)
      Checks if the argument value is of the proper type, also, if it's null/omitted, in which case it can throw an exception or return a default value.
      static Boolean castArgumentValueToBoolean(TemplateModel argValue, int argIdx, boolean optional, Boolean defaultValue, TemplateCallableModel callable, boolean calledAsFunction)
      See castArgumentValue(TemplateModel, int, Class, boolean, TemplateModel, TemplateCallableModel, boolean); this does the same, but with TemplateBooleanModel as type, and with Boolean return value.
      static int castArgumentValueToInt(TemplateModel argValue, int argIdx, boolean optional, int defaultValue, TemplateCallableModel callable, boolean calledAsFunction)
      See castArgumentValue(TemplateModel, int, Class, boolean, TemplateModel, TemplateCallableModel, boolean); this does the same, but with TemplateNumberModel as type and with the restriction that the number must be convertable to int losselessly, and with int return value.
      static Number castArgumentValueToNumber(TemplateModel argValue, int argIdx, boolean optional, Number defaultValue, TemplateCallableModel callable, boolean calledAsFunction)
      See castArgumentValue(TemplateModel, int, Class, boolean, TemplateModel, TemplateCallableModel, boolean); this does the same, but with TemplateNumberModel as type, and with Number return value.
      static String castArgumentValueToString(TemplateModel argValue, int argIdx, boolean optional, String defaultValue, TemplateCallableModel callable, boolean calledAsFunction)
      See castArgumentValue(TemplateModel, int, Class, boolean, TemplateModel, TemplateCallableModel, boolean); this does the same, but with TemplateStringModel as type, and with String return value.
      static void checkArgumentCount(int argCnt, int minCnt, int maxCnt, TemplateCallableModel callable, boolean calledAsFunction)
      Useful when the ArgumentArrayLayout is null and so the argument array length is not fixed, to check if the number of arguments is in the given range.
      static void checkArgumentCount(int argCnt, int minCnt, int maxCnt, TemplateDirectiveModel callable)

      static TemplateException newNullOrOmittedArgumentException(int argIdx, TemplateCallableModel callable, boolean calledAsFunction) 
      static TemplateException newNullOrOmittedArgumentException(int argIdx, TemplateDirectiveModel callable) 
      static TemplateException newNullOrOmittedArgumentException(int argIdx, TemplateFunctionModel callable) 
      static <T> T unwrapAndCastArgumentValue(TemplateModel argValue, int argIdx, Class<T> type, boolean optional, T defaultValue, TemplateCallableModel callable, boolean calledAsFunction, ObjectWrapperAndUnwrapper objectWrapperAndUnwrapper)
      Unwrap the argument to a plain Java object first and checks if the argument value is of the proper type, also, if it's null/omitted, in which case it can throw an exception or return a default value.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public static final TemplateModel[] EMPTY_TEMPLATE_MODEL_ARRAY

      • newGenericExecuteException

        public static TemplateException newGenericExecuteException(String errorDescription,
                                                           TemplateCallableModel callable,
                                                           boolean calledAsFunction,
                                                           Throwable cause)
        Creates an exception related to the execution of a TemplateCallableModel, for which there's no more specific method in CallableUtils.
        Parameters:
        errorDescription - Complete sentence describing the problem. This will be shown after "When calling Foo: ".
        callable - The TemplateCallableModel whose execution was failed.; required for printing proper error message.
        calledAsFunction - Tells if the callable was called as function (as opposed to called as a directive), which is needed for proper error messages. This information is needed because a TemplateCallableModel might implements both TemplateFunctionModel and TemplateDirectiveModel.

      • newArgumentValueException

        public static TemplateException newArgumentValueException(int argIdx,
                                                          String problemDescription,
                                                          TemplateDirectiveModel callable)

      • newArgumentValueException

        public static TemplateException newArgumentValueException(int argIdx,
                                                          String problemDescription,
                                                          TemplateCallableModel callable,
                                                          boolean calledAsFunction)
        Parameters:
        problemDescription - The continuation of a sentence like "When calling xxx: The 1st argument ", for example "must be a positive number.".

        Throws:

      • unwrapAndCastArgumentValue

        public static <T> T unwrapAndCastArgumentValue(TemplateModel argValue,
                                               int argIdx,
                                               Class<T> type,
                                               boolean optional,
                                               T defaultValue,
                                               TemplateCallableModel callable,
                                               boolean calledAsFunction,
                                               ObjectWrapperAndUnwrapper objectWrapperAndUnwrapper)
                                        throws TemplateException
        Unwrap the argument to a plain Java object first and checks if the argument value is of the proper type, also, if it's null/omitted, in which case it can throw an exception or return a default value.

        The point of this method is not only to decrease the boiler plate needed for these common checks, but also to standardize the error message content. If the checks themselves don't fit your needs, you should still use newArgumentValueTypeException(TemplateModel, int, Class, TemplateCallableModel, boolean) and its overloads, also newNullOrOmittedArgumentException(int, TemplateCallableModel, boolean) and its overloads to generate similar error messages.

        Parameters:
        argValue - The argument value at the position of argIdx.
        argIdx - The index in the args array (assumed to be a valid index. This is information is needed for proper error messages.
        type - The expected class of the unwrapped argument as plain Java object (not a TemplateModel subinterface). null if there are no type restrictions.
        optional - If we allow the parameter to be null or omitted.
        defaultValue - The value to return if the parameter was null or omitted.
        callable - The TemplateCallableModel whose argument we cast; required for printing proper error message.
        calledAsFunction - Tells if the callable was called as function (as opposed to called as a directive). This information is needed because a TemplateCallableModel might implements both TemplateFunctionModel and TemplateDirectiveModel, in which case this method couldn't tell if the argument of which we are casting.
        objectWrapperAndUnwrapper - The ObjectWrapperAndUnwrapper instance to use when unwrapping the argument to a plain Java object.
        Returns:
        The argument value of the proper type.
        Throws:
        TemplateException - If the argument is not of the proper type or is non-optional yet null/omitted. The error message describes the problem in detail, and is meant to be shown for the template author.

      • castArgumentValue

        public static <T extends TemplateModel> T castArgumentValue(TemplateModel argValue,
                                                            int argIdx,
                                                            Class<T> type,
                                                            boolean optional,
                                                            T defaultValue,
                                                            TemplateCallableModel callable,
                                                            boolean calledAsFunction)
                                                     throws TemplateException
        Checks if the argument value is of the proper type, also, if it's null/omitted, in which case it can throw an exception or return a default value.

        The point of this method is not only to decrease the boiler plate needed for these common checks, but also to standardize the error message content. If the checks themselves don't fit your needs, you should still use newArgumentValueTypeException(TemplateModel, int, Class, TemplateCallableModel, boolean) and its overloads, also newNullOrOmittedArgumentException(int, TemplateCallableModel, boolean) and its overloads to generate similar error messages.

        Parameters:
        argIdx - The index in the args array (assumed to be a valid index. This is information is needed for proper error messages.
        type - The expected class of the argument (usually a TemplateModel subinterface). null if there are no type restrictions.
        optional - If we allow the parameter to be null or omitted.
        defaultValue - The value to return if the parameter was null or omitted.
        callable - The TemplateCallableModel whose argument we cast; required for printing proper error message.
        calledAsFunction - Tells if the callable was called as function (as opposed to called as a directive). This information is needed because a TemplateCallableModel might implements both TemplateFunctionModel and TemplateDirectiveModel, in which case this method couldn't tell if the argument of which we are casting.
        Returns:
        The argument value of the proper type.
        Throws:
        TemplateException - If the argument is not of the proper type or is non-optional yet null/omitted. The error message describes the problem in detail, and is meant to be shown for the template author.

      • checkArgumentCount

        public static void checkArgumentCount(int argCnt,
                                      int minCnt,
                                      int maxCnt,
                                      TemplateCallableModel callable,
                                      boolean calledAsFunction)
                               throws TemplateException
        Useful when the ArgumentArrayLayout is null and so the argument array length is not fixed, to check if the number of arguments is in the given range.
        Parameters:
        argCnt - The actual length of the argument array
        minCnt - The minimum expected number of arguments
        maxCnt - The maximum expected number of arguments. Should be equal to or greater than minCnt
        callable - The TemplateCallableModel whose argument we cast; required for printing proper error message.
        calledAsFunction - Tells if the callable was called as function (as opposed to called as a directive). This information is needed because a TemplateCallableModel might implements both TemplateFunctionModel and TemplateDirectiveModel, in which case this method couldn't tell if the argument of which we are casting.
        Throws:
        TemplateException
